text: Could someone please commit this patch??

Your proposed patch is invalid.
context.getManager() returns a o.a.c.Manager 
getActiveSessions() is not part of the Manager interface. This is why it is 
written the way it is.
creator: markt@apache.org

text:
Is there anyway this could be added to the interface?  It is just a bit annoying
to turn a hashmap into an array, return the array and then get the array's
length.  Am I missing some reason why getActiveSessions() can't be in the
interface aside from a somewhat confusing name?
creator: masque@inetsolve.com

text:
Notice getActiveSessions() has been added to o.a.c.Manager in TC5 (as of
5.0.24).
creator: jan.luehe@sun.com

text:
I have committed this change to TC5.

I do not intent to commit the patch to TC4 as it requires a change to the 
o.a.c.Manger interface. Whilst this change appears to be pretty harmless it 
still carries a small risk of introducing regressions for some users. I do not 
believe that the benefit that this patch brings is sufficient to justify the 
associated risk at this late stage of the TC4 development cycle.

I am marking this bug report as WONTFIX as it is reported against TC4.
creator: markt@apache.org
